div.em: The mission of Parker Unified School District is to provide comprehensive, success-oriented learning activities for young people in our schools. These opportunities are designed to develop the student's potential in the areas of academic ability and vocational awareness, cultural appreciation, physical well-being, social development, and community contribution.

div.strong: SCHOOL CLOSED THROUGH THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR 2019-2020!
div.br: On March 30, 2020, the Governor of Arizona, Doug Ducey, has ordered all schools in the state closed through the end of the school year 2019-2020. While this may bring up many questions regarding graduation, promotion, and retention.

div.div: Visit the Frequently asked questions for more information. We will continue to update via the FAQ and One Call Now as details become available.
$51,319 - average salary of all teachers employed in FY 2019
$46,857 - average salary of all teachers employed in FY 2018
$4,462 - increase in average teacher salary from the prior year

article.aria-label: IMPORTANT!! Frequently Asked Questions Regarding COVID-19

h3.a: IMPORTANT!! Frequently Asked Questions Regarding COVID-19

article.aria-label: Meal Program During Shutdown (click here to access the waiver to pick up meals)

h3.a: Meal Program During Shutdown (click here to access the waiver to pick up meals)

div.div:
The USDA has granted a waiver to PUSD so we can distribute nutrition bags without the child ages 0-18 having to be present. You will be asked to fill out a form that can be picked up where you get the nutrition bags. Fill it out and return it to begin the waiver for your family. Again this is for all kids age 0-18.
Visit Frequently Asked Questions for Food Pickup Locations
